description:
We recieved the following support request:

"When I was getting VNC timeout the other day it was because I was 1. behind a firewall and 2. using a secure VPN tunnel. Please can the VNC proxy that is launched via the Dashboard be placed on port 443? This will make life easier for peeps in my situation."

I tried the following fixes:

* I checked to see if there is a nova config option to specify the port novncproxy listens on. There isn't.
* I terminated the vncproxy on 6080 with a nginx frontend to give SSL support on port 443. This breaks the vncproxy.
* I used iptables PREROUTING to portfw --dport 80 to real port 6080. This also breaks the vncproxy.

As far as I can tell from the reference nova config options on docs.openstack.org there is only a listen port config option for the XCP VNC server? 

Please advise. We would require this fix to be pushed to Folsom and the Ubuntu Cloud Archive.
title: nova-novncproxy no listen port config option

comments.content:
cfg.StrOpt('novncproxy_host',
               default='0.0.0.0',
               help='Host on which to listen for incoming requests'),

comments.content:
Hi Chuck, not only do they not work, they don't exist, and if you put them in nova.conf then novncproxy crashes.

# dpkg -l | grep novnc
ii  nova-novncproxy                  2012.2-0ubuntu5~cloud0               OpenStack Compute - NoVNC proxy
ii  novnc                            2012.2~20120906+dfsg-0ubuntu4~cloud0 HTML5 VNC client
ii  python-novnc                     2012.2~20120906+dfsg-0ubuntu4~cloud0 HTML5 VNC client - libraries

and this is the output of /usr/share/pyshared/nova/vnc/__init__.py

vnc_opts = [
    cfg.StrOpt('novncproxy_base_url',
               default='http://127.0.0.1:6080/vnc_auto.html',
               help='location of vnc console proxy, in the form '
                    '"http://127.0.0.1:6080/vnc_auto.html"'),
    cfg.StrOpt('xvpvncproxy_base_url',
               default='http://127.0.0.1:6081/console',
               help='location of nova xvp vnc console proxy, in the form '
                    '"http://127.0.0.1:6081/console"'),
    cfg.StrOpt('vncserver_listen',
               default='127.0.0.1',
               help='Ip address on which instance vncserversshould listen'),
    cfg.StrOpt('vncserver_proxyclient_address',
               default='127.0.0.1',
               help='the address to which proxy clients '
                    '(like nova-xvpvncproxy) should connect'),
    cfg.BoolOpt('vnc_enabled',
                default=True,
                help='enable vnc related features'),
    cfg.StrOpt('vnc_keymap',
               default='en-us',
               help='keymap for vnc'),
    ]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sina-sa

comments.content:
Ah I see, the IntOpt you are referring to is in:

/usr/bin/nova-novncproxy

and yes, I have that IntOpt present in my nova-novncproxy file, but as I said, when I put 

"novncproxy_port=80" into nova.conf, nova-novncproxy crashes on restarting the service with 'service nova-novncproxy restart'.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sina-sa

comments.content:
Also for the record, there is no option 

"novncproxy_port" listed in the doc,

http://docs.openstack.org/folsom/openstack-compute/admin/content/compute-options-reference.htm (or anywhere in the doc)

Forcing ops staff to go poking around in the code looking for config options is highly undesirable.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sina-sa

comments.content:
On advise from Tom, I checked to see if this was a root permission issue (i.e. novncproxy running as nova, no access to ports < 1024), he is correct. I can change 

novncproxy_port=9999 

and it works:

root@api01:~# vim /etc/nova/nova.conf
root@api01:~# service nova-novncproxy restart
nova-novncproxy stop/waiting
nova-novncproxy start/running, process 1688
root@api01:~# ps ax | grep vnc | grep -v grep
 1688 ?        Ss     0:00 su -s /bin/sh -c exec nova-novncproxy --config-file=/etc/nova/nova.conf nova
 1689 ?        S      0:00 /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/nova-novncproxy --config-file=/etc/nova/nova.conf
root@api01:~# netstat -tulanp | grep 9999
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:9999            0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      1689/python
